New Records: Cavs are just the seventh team in history to open a season with a 32-4 record or better
The Cavs are the first team in NBA history to shoot over 50% from the field and over 40% from 3 in a single season
Key Match Events: Cavs outscored OKC 23-15 in the final 9:05 while holding the Thunder scoreless for the final two minutes to earn a hard-fought dub
Donovan Mitchell’s two-handed hammer right before the half put them up 62-59 at the break
Down 107-106, Cleveland went on a 8-0 spurt to take control
In the clutch, the Cavs slammed the door, outscoring the Thunder 13-6, including 5-0 in the final two minutes to stamp a statement win
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavs’ depth shined when it mattered most
The Cavs are just the seventh team in history to open a season with a 32-4 record or better
Post-Match Reflections: Jarrett Allen led the way for the Cavs with 25 points, 11 rebounds, six assists and three steals
Evans Mobley added 21 points, 10 boards and seven dimes
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavs are improving their NBA-best record to 32-4 with a statement
The Cavs’ historic start puts it in rare company
The Cavs are on pace to become the first team in NBA history to shoot over 50% from the field and over 40% from 3 in a single season
Others: The Thunder met the Cavs for the first time this season
The Cavs have won 11 straight games
